Reviews.Title: “FOOTBALL TRIP TO MADRID”
Reviews.Author: SigneLouise
Reviews.Content: I want to thank the reception personell and the staff working in the breakfast restaurant,the breakfast was very good,but the price could have been lower for 5 days. The WIFI connetion was good,but after 2 days it only worked for 1 hour in the room,but excellent in the reception area. We will for sure come again later,and maybye try some of your other hotels in Spain. The Aircondition worked very well,and we used it every night. The only Minus I have to add is that there were alot of loud sound outside of the hotel room on the 7th floor,but other than that, EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Staff but no swimmingpool”
Reviews.Author: Barbie169
Reviews.Content: Thank U Mr. Zacarias for You kindness at the breakfast table. U work with a smile! There is no swimmingpool or fitnessroom. Also the people at the reception are very nice. U have free WIFI and they help u as much as they can. The only minus is: its next to the redlightdistrict on the leftside of the hotel. A good thing is. Its in the Centre of Madrid. Everything is in Walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable rooms, helpful concierge, barely any English.”
Reviews.Author: Tootickytoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be more central just off the Gran Via. The rooms were big, bathroom clean and one had a balcony, which was enclosed with glass but you could open a window and there was enough room for a chair. The air conditioning worked really well the first night and was very quiet. The second day there were suddenly a lot of guests and the air conditioning seemed to be less effective. We wondered whether it wasn't able to cope so well when the hotel was full. That was the only criticism. We had fresh towels provided every day. The staff were all very pleasant and polite but none spoke much English. The concierge chap downstairs was really helpful and rushed down the alley each morning to hail a taxi for us, which never took more than a few minutes. Breakfast was the usual continental buffet plus hot scrambled eggs and bacon. I asked for milk with my tea the first morning and the waiter very kindly provided hot milk. I hadn't the heart to send it back. The next morning I had coffee! Reception is on the first floor. There is only breakfast provided but there is room service, which we didn't use. I loved Madrid and would stay at the same hotel if I am ever lucky enough to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and confortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: miguel s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in middle of july 2012 and we very happy with it. Will come again. Great location and access to subways and sightseeing tour bus, all within 1 minute walking distance. Plaza del sol is 15 minutes walking. room were very clean and comfortable. highly recommend it. left my camera in the safe and some cash in the safe which I had forgotten. Called them up and they had saved my items. Luckily I had a friend in Madrid who stopped by and picked them up for me. This tells you how safe your things are and their integrity on running a first class business.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Pouriam
Reviews.Content: Its my second time that I select a TRYP hotel. The firast one was in Munchen around 5 years ago and as I remmembered that it was a spanish chain hotel I decided to select it in Madrid. Its situation was fantastic and we did not to travel in the city by taxi or even metro as it was close to all important things in center of Madrid. Rooms were small but clean and comfort and it was very similar to the other TRYP hotel which I have saw in Munchen.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Bassammississauga
Reviews.Content: Location: The location is the only good thing good about this hotel as it is in the downtown area. The neighbourhood is very touristy and stays ate. We had all our meals in this area. Room: small, dark, old furnished. Establishment: Old. You actually hear the other toilets being flushed in the rooms above. Ceilings tainted with signs of leaks. Breakfast: Did not purchase it as all sorts of cafes are just on the hotel door steps. Staff: Not friendly and almost rude. Would I go back? No, I will pay more to be in a better (newer) hotel in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: atabh
Reviews.Content: Location; The hotel is situated on the bustling Gran Via which is one of the main streets of Madrid. The metro stations of Callao, Gran Via and Sol are within a 2-5 minutes walking radius and make it convenient to access any part of the city. There is a McDonalds, Starbucks and many restaurants alongwith Zara and Mango shopping stores right next to the hotel. Rooms: Decent sized twin rooms with good closet space and enough room to store 2 cchecked in bags and 2 carry on bags.Rooms are clean and well maintained. Bathroom is of a decent size as well compared to most European Hotels. Beds and pillows very comfortable. Water presuure in the shower is very good and housekeeping is efficient. Had a street facing room (on request) on the 6th floor and did not find the noise too bothersome. The soundproofing is pretty decent. Reception: Friendly , helpful and speak decent English Would definitely stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed staying there!!”
Reviews.Author: Maria M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on Gran Via - one of the main streets of the city. All places of interest - Puerta del Sol, Prado Museum, The Royal Palace,etc - are in a few minutes of walk. The hotel is very clean and cosy, the service and breakfasts are really good. Thanks for a great holiday spent there!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay...”
Reviews.Author: jj92805
Reviews.Content: stayed here during our madrid stop, yes the reception area is small on the second floor, but they have a doorman and the entrance is only few steps form main street (Gran Via). Requested an inner room away from the noise, and it was a very quiet and peaceful stay. Rooms have been updated, very nice large bathroom, and nice large room with comfy beds. The hotel is very clean throughout. Had a wonderful stay...

Reviews.Title: “Poor External Appearance”
Reviews.Author: ClarkGibraltar
Reviews.Content: Yes the location is very central and good for shopping but what lets this hotel down is it's external appearance. It's down a dark side street and you would be hard pushed to find it if arriving in the dark. The facia and sign are not lit, you enter a small vestibule area,which is well lit and has a porter and two lifts which take you to a very small reception area on floor 1. When we were there a tour bus full of guests arrived and they just could not cope. Reception was submerged and the lifts fully occupied for ages - fortunately we were going out at the time and used the stairs! The room and bathroom were large and well appointed. The beds were big and comfortable and there was no surrounding noise. Would question whether this a 4 star and would probably choose another Tryp hotel in Madrid next time round (the Ambassador and Atocha looked nicer!)

Reviews.Title: “Easy shopping”
Reviews.Author: Panyale
Reviews.Content: Very good location if you plan to go shopping easy walks to plaza del sol and the arenal street and right on the Gran via too. The Hotel is modern and clean. Didn't haveof a main entrance so the Lobby is tiny and tends to be crowded must of the time. Not easy to get to the breakfast buffet. The breakfast buffet had a great selection of items. I think that the best thing with the hotel was the location. Metro station just 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnfromWilts
Reviews.Content: On arriving at Madrid Airport the most economical way of getting to the hotel was to catch the Exprés Aeropuerto (Airport Express), a 24-hour service which has only 3 stops after the airport: O'Donell, Plaza de Cibeles and Atocha The buses run every 15 minutes during the day and every 35 minutes at night, and the journey takes approximately 40 minutes. Tickets cost 2 Euros and may be bought on board. There are stops at terminals T1, T2 and T4. We arrived at Terminal 1 and easily found the bus stop on the right hand side of Arrivals when exiting the terminal. The bus is painted half yellow, so is easy to spot. We had a wait of about 15 minutes before getting on a bus, and noted that if we wanted to catch a taxi there would have been a similar wait. The luggage is stored internally to reduce delays. The journey took about 35 minutes and we got off at the second stop; Plaza Cibeles. To get to the hotel from Plaza Cibeles, we walked along Calle Gran Via, one of the main roads in Madrid. There is a “Y” junction along the route, so make sure that you take the right hand side of the junction. The walk took us about 20 minutes. The hotel is on a corner between Calle Gran Via and Calle de Masonero Romanos (a narrow side turning). The name of the hotel is only visible over the entrance in the side turning. The lobby of the hotel was small for the size of the building, but we were directed to the reception desk on the first floor, reached via a lift. The reception staff were very helpful and provided us with information on what to see in the city. We requested a room on an upper level and were given a choice of third floor inner, or fourth floor outer overlooking Calle Gran Via. We chose the latter and were not disappointed. The room was of medium size (sizes vary), which was adequate and we could only just hear the traffic. The condition and facilities within the room were of a high standard and the room was clean and well maintained by the staff. The hotel does not have a restaurant for evening meals and this is not necessary given the plethora of tapas bars and restaurants surrounding the hotel. It does however have a well maintained breakfast room and there is a good selection of hot and cold breakfasts, including fresh orange juice (not the usual syrup) and freshly baked croissants, which I found very tasty. If having tea, make sure that you are given a hot pot of water and not a tepid one. Our overall impression of the hotel was very good and it justified its 4 star status. The hotel is within walking distance of many of the attractions, including the old town and many shops. We purchased the 2 day tickets for the Madrid City Tour bus from the hotel reception; 24 Euros for adults, 12 Euros for seniors (over 65). The buses ran every 15 minutes and were a handy way of getting around and seeing the sites, allowing passengers to get on and off as many times as they wish. This enabled us to quickly establish the location of the sites and shops within walking distance of the hotel. There are many splendid buildings and museums to see in Madrid and both bus routs cover the majority of them, but the Route 1 bus probably covers the better half. Our evenings were spent in a selection of tapas/pinchos bars and restaurants, consuming the delightful Spanish food and wine. One of the restaurants to the rear of the hotel was the “Public” restaurant, which is located by turning left when exiting the hotel, then turning second left onto Calle Del Desengaño, the road which runs parallel to Calle Gran Via (see reviews). The restaurant is modern and clean and served by efficient staff. The prices are very reasonable, for both the excellent food and wine. Also, pay a visit to the Plaza Mayor and take lunch in the square. Just outside of the square is an undercover tapas area known as Mercado de San Miguel, it looks like a market place from the outside, but inside is an array of tapas bars, where you can purchase tapas and wine and wander from one bar to the other. Another tapas bar that we enjoyed was “Stop”, on Calle Hortaleza (no. 11), just a short walk from Calle Gran Via and close to the hotel. This is a traditional tapas bar that had a wide selection of tasty tapas and wines, and if you ask for a brandy you will get at least four times the UK measurement.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Convenient in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: EscapingtheBurg
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, and I arrived in Madrid on a morning flight from the USA. The hotel personnel allowed us to check in early (about 10:30 AM) so we could drop our bags off and get a little refreshed before heading out to see Madrid. The hotel clerks were very pleasant, helpful, and spoke good English. The hotel entrance is located about 30 yards (27 m) from Calle Gran Via down a small side street with very little traffic. A couple of times taxi drivers were not aware of its location because it is a little hidden and had to be directed with my Google map. Our room was away from the main street, Calle Gran Via, so it was very quiet with no street noise. The location was very good for Metro stations and a short 10 to 12 minute walk to Plaza Espana where we met tour buses for half day tours through Julia Travel. The location is also convenient to many restaurants, shopping, and other tourist sites such as Palacio Real. We had a large triple room (3 beds) with ample room. Our room was made up nicely each day by the maid service. Breakfast was included and had a nice variety of meats, fresh fruits, and breads. I wouldn't call it expansive but it certainly tasted good and was adequate for tourists ready to hit the town. This hotel does not have a lot of amenities but it is great for those in Madrid as tourists spending most of their time on the town as it is clean, quiet, and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Fiend_007
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in Madrid and overall, our stay at the hotel was great. We were fortunate to get a room with a balcony. However, it is loud for 18-20 hours of the day since you are right against the Gran Via. Room was clean except for some dust on the hardwood floors. Beds were a bit stiff and older. Bathroom was big and clean. Our balcony was great, able to see the action on Gran Via. Plenty of shops near you and only 10 minute walk to the Puerto del Sol. Lobby was bright and clean with free WiFi. We did not eat the breakfast. Overall, would stay here again. Great value with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PKNelson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant in every way. Very clean, pleasant helpful staff, lovely bedrooms and suberb en-suite bathroom. The best breakfast choices I have ever seen -and at half price if paid for locally with free card from hoteI. Ideally located on main street which is centrally located and within easy walking distance of most places of interest but also close to metro station. Pleanty of restaraunts and bars close by. The city tour bus stops almost outside hotel which is an excellent way to find out where places are and some history about them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very well situated”
Reviews.Author: dorinast
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, with spacious rooms and very clean. The staff were friendly and always eager to help in any way. The breakfast was excellent. Some slight problems with the wifi (it got disconnected every once in a while and it was a nightmare to use through the mobile), but nothing that somebody couldn't survive. Highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a Tryp”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonCJ2
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute single room at the Tryp Cibeles via hotels.com. The room was small no more than 8'X10' but well appointed and the bath was truly lovely with marble and inlays. I didn't have the 18 euro breakfast or the paid wifi but would recommend the hotel to travelers who want to be close to everything and not spend a ton. the hotel is on Gran Via between the Callao Plaza station and Grand Via stations. Plaza Mayor is a 10-15 walk, Sol is 10 minutes, Museum Triangle is approx 25min. Friendly staff let me check in at 1030 vs 1600 and when I was checking out they held my bags for me while I hit one last museum. My complaints: the twin bed was very firm, too firm for my tastes, but maybe not for yours. The room service is provided by a pizza place and a sushi place but the phone numbers listed were incorrect in the hotel info but correct on the provided menus. And they hotel didn't pick up the auto room service or front desk numbers after 7pm for me to order anything. Tips: Skip the Starbucks at Callao and on Gran via and stop at Pans for your coffee, bread and free wifi. Beer costs the same as bottled water and sodas, but wine can be significantly more. Keep your bathroom door closed, the sound insulation isn't great.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: john w
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in Feb. Hotel is on the main Street so everthing is within walking distance. We did not get a taxi, metro or bus for the duration of our stay. Plaza del Sol (centre of Madrid) is a 5 minute walk through some nice side streets. The hotel is very nice, the room was very modern and very clean. Room was a bit small however but the bathroom was big so not really an issue (i did see into another room when the cleaner was in there and it looked a lot bigger so we may have been a bit unlucky with the room we were given!) saying that, I would definately stay here again as it is reasonably priced and is worth staying in for the location alone! I had read in other reviews that the rooms were noisy as a result of the main street outside but out room was not facing the street so this was not an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY”
Reviews.Author: RTKL2
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on Grand Via. Within walking distance of most sites. Very clean room, good shower and towels. Family room for four adults was great value. Staff polite and helpful. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Located in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: myoshi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights December 19 to 23rd 2011, myself and 3 teenagers. Location - Right in the heart of the city along the Gran Via. Entrance to hotel is along a sidestreet to the Gran Via. Actually preferred this rather than along the main blvd. Note that the street outside was busy 20 hours of the day/night during the holiday season. This was certainlyh expected along this main street. Expect typical noise from a busy central city street including ambulances, police, trash trucks, shoppers and people partying in the City. We didn't care but it might bother those light sleepers. I preferred being able to look out and enjoyed the street scenes. Ideal for nearby shopping, restaurants, bus stop and metro stations. Metro stations for 4 different lines within 2 minute walk from hotel. ATM located one minute from hotel along Gran Via. Several tapas bars within 500 yards of hotel. City Tour bus stop 1 minute away. No real need for taxis while staying at this hotel. We never felt unsafe although the evenings brought out some very interesting characters north of the hotel along the sidestreet. Rooms - Well maintained, comfortable size by European standards. Appears to have been improved with relatively recent modernization of bathroom and sleeping area. Bathroom fixtures and shower/tub were more than functional. Twin beds were comfortable. Didn't use the TV much. Wifi was 8 euro for 24 hours, a tad pricey and the range was very limited near the window. Housekeeping was very efficient and kept the room tidy. The room was warmed (almost too much)by the sun radiating into the enclosed balcony. Opening the window was the fast and easy solution. Amenities - Breakfast was very nice with a pot of hot spanish coffee (!) or tea upon seating, nice buffet of coldcuts, cheeses, fresh fruits, juices, churros (spanish version) croissants and breads. Service was fast and generally excellent. Staff was polite, friendly and helpful from check-in to check-out. No complaints. They have a person (guard?) stationed on street level loosely monitoring the people entering the hotel and going up the elevators. They were helpful directing us with maps and the locations of museums, etc. I would gladly stay at this hotel again and I believe it was a good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: boston_tripadviser
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights at this hotel and overall had a pleasant experience. The location is perfect, right on the main shopping street in Madrid and between two subway stops. My room was large and modern, and the Gran Via view was nice. My room had a mini balcony which was enclosed by a glass door. Large TV, but only local channels. Very nice bathroom--again, large and spotless. The hotel is also within easy walking distance (10 minutes or so) to the closest drop-off point for the very cheap and convenient airport bus. (2 Euros per trip) In addition to the many positives, there were a few negatives as well: Expensive and very slow WiFi (I ended up asking for a refund because it was virtually useless). There it a coffee shop called Coffee y Tea (or something like that) a few steps from the hotel when you turn left onto Gran Via. Very good free WiFi, even if you just stand outside. Quite a few people were doing just that. No air conditioning (maybe it was turned off because it was November), but the room was rather warm at times. Beds were not particularly comfortable All in all, though, a nice place to stay, especially considering the low price. Not the ideal business hotel, however.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Overall A rating.”
Reviews.Author: Qrottyspj
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Spain a week ago. I choosen this hotel from read from this site. My rating are following... Perfect location for in the center of the city. For shopping, restaurants. Our flight arrived city in the early morning, about 7:30am local time in the morning. Went to the hotel checked in early had no problem. Spent $16 Euro per night got upgrade room top of the floor, with main street city view. Because the hotel and room on the main street. At night you will hear trash truck up and down the street. Windows are functionble. We were able to opened it up to get ride off smoking smell. Hotel has no bellboy services. Checking on the second floor. I booked with breakfas everyday. The breakfast does offer hot meal also. Has many choices. Very adequate to U.S 3 starts to 3 1/2 rate. Room and bathroom are cleaning. If I will go to Madrid again. I will choice of this hotel again, personally.

Reviews.Title: “Tryp Cibeles - Not for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: Walt N
Reviews.Content: Great location and was looking forward to the company's 'tag-line' which is work hard play hard. Here are my problems and I see I'm not the only one. Internet was down for 2 days. I'm here on business for 3 days and for 2 of them I have to go to Starbucks to get my work done. I'm told (by friendly staff) that management says they won't reduce my charges ('it's not their fault'). WOW - - so no business work here. Second, DO NOT Stay on the first floor. The doors slamming and vacuuming at 7am and constant traffic was ridiculous. I had to wear ear plugs to sleep. No more for me. Adios Tryp Cibeles and no coming back !! If you are here on business forget about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: chrispgr
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a Madrid weekend getaway. We chose the Tryp Cibeles due to its location and as we had been able to find a very good price. We were extremely pleased with the hotel, as it what it offers is value for money and good service. We were lucky that we were upgraded to a room with Gran Via room (room 608), as this room is rather spacious and with a big bathroom. The only problem is that Gran Via can get very noisy at night and sometime too noisy that if you are a light sleeper this may be a problem. Otherwise, you can choose a room facing the side street. The reception is rather small and located on the first floor and can get crowded at times. But the receptionists are friendly and always eager to assist you and fast. The breakfast is very good and with a good quality and quantity. As the food is exactly the same everyday, it would be nice if they would make some changes so that people with short stays do not end up eating the same everyday. But overall it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: SeaCoral7
Reviews.Content: Tryp Cibeles is located right in the midst of all the main shopping streets, restaurants, bars, cafes and all the sights.. Very friendly staff, delicious breakfast each morning. Clean rooms with wood floors.

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: chileboy
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this hotel. The location for tourist purposes can't be beat. Employees are friendly. At first glance the rooms are nice. But... the internet connection doesn't work, and you have to pay for the "no service". The worst part, though, was the noise. Oddly, it wasn't street noise, but rather internal. The doors slam shut loudly, and it's not necessarily due to the people shutting the doors. It sounds like it's happening inside the room. Groups that get back late, you can hear everything they're saying. And you can hear conversations in adjacent rooms. I don't recommend this hotel unless you can sleep through just about anything.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Simon_of_Henley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a work "Jolly" with a load of colleagues. Hotel was a little spartan, but no real complaints - well located for tourism, and a walk away from nightclub areas. The service was a little unforgiving - the hotel bar was closed, breakfast was over by 10:30 (on a weekend) and the receptionist charged a breakfast suppliment even though this was pre-paid. Our brilliant team assistant got us a refund, but I'm sure that without her we would have been charged twice. I possibly would stay here again, but only if much cheaper than the alternatives...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas1900
Reviews.Content: “Wonderful Stay!” We chose Tryp Cibeles Hotel for it's central location, as it is among the many busy areas. The buildings/scenery are magnificent! We always read hotel reviews, which we found to provide a very good rating, as was our opinion too. The staff were all extremely wonderful and caring. We're going back for an even longer stay!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: JAW2201
Reviews.Content: It was midnight when we arrived at the hotel and we were greeted by a smiling, helpful Inge, who offered us a bigger room, since we were staying for seven nights, with a balcony which ran right round the corner of the building. Inge gave us a map of Madrid and some tourist information which was very useful. Our room was very comfortable, clean and spacious with a huge bed, large bathroom, built-in wardrobes, safe, and air conditioning. The buffet breakfast, which was served from 7-11am every day, offered a wide choice of meats, cheeses, fruit, yoghurt, pastries, bread, eggs, bacon, cereals and juices! We can't recommend this hotel highly enough for someone wishing to visit Madrid, its central location means you're within walking distance of all the main attractions. There are plenty of restaurants/bars to choose from. If you get chance have a meal in El Estragon vegetarian restaurant, it does tend to be busy about 9pm but well worth getting a table. Would definitely go back to Tryp Cibeles and Madrid in general.

Reviews.Title: “Praiseworthy hotel - excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: K B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tryp Cibeles in September 2011 and overall we were very pleased. We were two females travelling to Madrid for the first time and having read some reviews on Trip Advisor we were concerned about the area being a prime spot for 'pickpockets' and 'ladies of the night' nonetheless I can honestly say we felt very safe. The location is just fantastic we were able to walk to most of the well known beautiful sights and landmarks. The hotel itself is very well maintained. Our room was spacious and clean. We were lucky to have a room with a balcony and though we were facing a noisy busy street, once the balcony doors were closed it blocked off ALL noise! The hotel staff were helpful particularly the staff at the breakfast buffet. The breakfast was fine and caters for all. We had no problems at all, in fact this would be our first choice when we return to Madrid next year. For good food I recommend travelers visit Plaza de Santa Ana with its many outside tapas restaurants, the ambiance in the evening is simply buzzing .Also there is a lovely restaurant named La Chulapa which is off the Gran Via with excellent food and staff! I hope your trip is as pleasurable as ours.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in the center”
Reviews.Author: lecherep
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Madrid near the metro. The road from the airport cost us 2 euros and took 30 minutes. Hotel rooms overlook the busy street (Gran Via) or in a quiet lane, If you like quiet then you need a second. The hotel entrance is also located in the alley. Nearby are many shops and restаurants on Gran Via. Rooms at the hotel are cozy and clean. Breakfast so we did not take about the buffet can not say anything. In general we liked the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tgz301
Reviews.Content: the best thing about this hotel is that is in a very good location you can walk to pretty much all the atraccions in madrid ...the rooms are ok they are clean a little bit noisy because is located in one of the main streets in Madrid..I really don't recommend the hotel's restaurant is food sometimes was kind of old and they had always the same at the buffet

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: NickS09
Reviews.Content: We walked everywhere from this hotel. Our second time being in madrid and this hotel was exactly what we were looking for. Close to the shopping district and just a really fun location to be around. The subway station is close if you want to travel anywhere in madrid. We upgraded our room for 16 euros and got the king bed. You can view your room if you want and get a better one. We decided to, not just because it was bigger but because it also included wifi for free. Otherwise it was a $10 euro charge. Also you get a coffee maker/ water boiler if you want tea in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: turnipfish
Reviews.Content: The check-in wasn´t a very good start. The staff didn´t speak much english and tried to convince us that we only had a booking for a standard room though we had payed extra for an upgrade when we booked the trip. They offered us to pay again for an upgrade, but after som arguing they found our booking and we got our premium room. The room, however, was clean and nice. Roomy with a large bathroom and a huge and comfortable bed. The airconditioning worked fine and there was a kind of small balcony. The only big flaw with the room was the minibar. It wasn´t cold at all, it smelled of milldew and the assortment wasn´t very impressive. But there are a lot of small shops all around for snacks and drinks. When you enter the hotel you have to take the elevator up to the reception. And now there´s no sign at all on Gran Via, but it wasn´t that hard to find. We didn´t eat breakfast at the hotel so I can´t say anything about it, but there were plenty of nice places to eat in the neighbourhood. As said in other reviews you might want to avoid the streets behind the hotel at night, but there are a lot of other places to be so I don´t se that as a big problem. I would definitly stay there again and I can recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location ...”
Reviews.Author: SafferB
Reviews.Content: We visited Madrid for a long weekend and was looking for a good hotel with central location. The Tryp Cibeles was an amazing find. Positioned right on the Gran Via Madrid, you could not ask for a better location. Close to all the shops, restaurants, within walking distance to the Palace, the Cathedral, Cibeles, Playa Major and many more. Check in was abit slow but once checked in, the room proved really comfortable. Good , clean and it addresses all of your needs during a city break viz: air-conditioned relaxing, welcoming clean room to retreat to after a hard days sight seeing. Breakfast was really good. I can strongly recommend this hotel and we will stay here again when next in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not very pleased, won't be back”
Reviews.Author: AnnaG65
Reviews.Content: The staff was not as friendly as other reviewers described. Breakfast was small and the quality was average. The rooms were clean. Lobby is small, located in second floor. Self service hotel. Centrally located, close to metro station and tour bus stop, next to Gran Via which after 10 pm was filled with guys selling beer, ladies of the evening and hoodlums. Not very safe specially if travelling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “nice family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: adlanefellah
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights there. It is close to the shopping area without teh noise of beign on Gran Via. Staff was friendly and helpful. One inconvenient is that the hotel only serves a breakfast, no room service or lunch /dinner served but there are plenty of neraby spots to eat within 1 block. The other inconvenient typical to Europe is that you have to pay for internet access...

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Terriloliver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as a 4 star hotel on several sites--not even close!! Incredibly small rooms. Staff is not knowledgeable about the area and not helpful at all. Check in took over 45 minutes. Was told room had 2 twins--did not and able to move. I am sure there are great things about Madrid, but this hotel is not one of them. It has put a big damper on the end of a very nice trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: leazo
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a last minute weekend in Madrid & it was amazing. The weather was so hot, u can see why they have a siesta in the day! We were looking for a hotel for ages & it us always hard reading other people's reviews but I have to say we picked an amazing one here. It is in the perfect location, it's walking distance to everything & there's a great cheap bar nxt door. We were lucky & had a room over looking the strip of bars & shops & the rooms were in perfect condition. We had bed & breakfast which wax fantastic & really set you up for the day. The staff are also very polite & helpful which was useful. I would defiantly recommend & stay on this hotel again. We had such a wonderful weekend staying there. Oh one tip for Madrid done bother getting a taxi, they rip you off, we ended up paying 37 euros! We were delayed and just wanted to get there so thought it would be quicker than the bus. On the way back we got the bus, it's from outside the post office, takes 20 mins & only cost 2 Euros each!!! Be warned tho the stop gets busy & it's who ever gets on first which is annoying if you've been sat there ages waiting! So not worth trying 2 catch the latest one closest to you flight as you may not get on.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy hotel in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: baiyzet
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my wife in April, during a trip to Spain. The advantages of this hotel are: -convenient location in the heart of Madrid, close to major attractions; -located in an old building with the original room and dining room -friendly staff -the rooms are clean with fresh repair The peculiarity of the hotel - the reception is on the 3rd floor, must enter into the entrance of the house and take the elevator. A good place for a reasonable price in the heart of Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - can't be beaten for the price”
Reviews.Author: suzysue
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the most fantastic location. We were very fortunate to have two bedrooms which had balconys and this just made the break. It was incredible, as we could watch the world go by our hotel whilst sitting on the balcony with a glass of wine. The hotel is being refurbished, but our rooms were already done and therefore everything was new and very clean and bright. The staff were very helpful and answered our queries. Its is about two minutes from the Metro, about the same to the bus stop for the tourist bus and there are shops aplenty all around. We were there for three nights which to be honest is not enough, simply as there is so much to see and do. There are loads of restaurants and bars from very cheap to very expensive. One negative we found was overall the Spanish here is Madrid are not very friendly, and dont know how to smile, just ignore you or glare, but it wouldnt put us off going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location.....”
Reviews.Author: KewTravellerLondon
Reviews.Content: First review here - thought was about time to start giving back some of the great reviews I have used to find hotels. Reception staff on arrival were great, very friendly. Had seen many others who had said some rooms were noisy so asked for a quiet room which is towards the back in the centre of the hotel. Room (non smoking) was great. Nicely decorated, looked into a central quadrangle so no view to speak off but it was bright and airy outside and most importantly - quiet! Nicely furnished with great bathroom. They even brought feather pillows up for me on request. Nice and central on Gran Via so perfect place to explore.

Reviews.Title: “great location, not so good service and unfriendly receptionist!”
Reviews.Author: sotski
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed by an unfriendly receptionist (I think her name is Inge) who initially told us we didn't have a reservation. Showed her the confirmation of our booking through lastminute.com and was finally given a room after huffs and puffs from her! The room was big and cosy but unfortunately we had to request for transfer after being waken up by a ridiculously smoky smell coming from the exhaust! It could have been avoided if we weren't allocated a 'smoking' room without our consent. The second receptionist (Ana) was really helpful and moved us to a non-smoking room but slightly smaller than the first one. The next morning, we requested for our breakfast which was included - as per written on our receipt. The rude receptionist - Inge was on duty again and politely (NOT!) told us they didn't have that package and lastminute was just 'making this up' to attract customers! She was so helpful (again - NOT!) and asked us to contact lastminute ourselves. I explained that this is a matter between them and luckily, another receptionist (Mercedes) agreed to make the call and to inform us afterwards. On checking out, Mercedes apologised and said we had free breakfast all along but was surprised no one bothered to tell us (duh!). At least, we got our free breakfast before leaving! The location is really good - very close to the Metro station (Gran Via or Callao) and just walking distance from several tourist attractions. The downside is - it's along Gran Via - one of the busiest street hence all the noise 24hours! But, we still managed to get some sleep, so don't let this put you off. I would rate the stay as good if it weren't for the polite receptionist (Inge) who messed up the booking registration from the beginning! However, there are other hotels in the same area which you could consider. Who knows, they may have friendlier staffs who would treat their clients appropriately! Maybe we ought to let the management know how some of their staffs can affect the service they're providing!

Reviews.Title: “They wouldn't give us our pre-paid, guaranteed for late arrival room”
Reviews.Author: travel_mania2010
Reviews.Content: I'd like to review this hotel, but unfortunately I can't because although our room was pre-paid and guaranteed for late arrival, we were shunted to another hotel farther from the centre of Madrid, which meant that we had to take the Metro everywhere. When we arrived, we were told that our room had been given away, and that even if we had called and said we would be arriving late (we didn't think this necessary since it was guaranteed), they still would have given it away, because the law in Spain allows them to do this. Having complained to Expedia upon our return, the hotel's response now was that they couldn't give us our room because their computer systems were down and they didn't know which rooms were available. Which story to believe? They refused to make any concessions to us. To be fair, they did find us a room at a five-star hotel, but this hotel was not near the centre, and we had to take taxis and the metro instead of walking as was our original plan. Not impressed with the treatment we received at this hotel, and can't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: gingerboy59
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away just off Gran Via and the location couldn't be more perfect. On arrival, you go into a small hallway with lifts and you have to go to the first floor for reception but don't let first impressions put you off, the hotel is actually brilliant. The rooms are being modernised right now and we couldn't have asked for a better room. We were asked if we wanted a road view or a quiet room and having read some of the reviews on here, we opted for the quiet room which was fantastic - the view was amazing across Madrid (we were on the 5th floor). We were room only, though you can pay 14 euros for breakfast, which we thought was a bit steep considering there wasn't a huge amount of choice. However, there are loads of places to eat on the main road so it's not really a problem. It was very quiet at night and the beds were comfortable. The pillows are quite hard and lumpy but you can ask at reception for feather ones and these were much better. The only negative thing I have to say is about the staff. They were generally rude, abrupt and moody, though we found this true of all Madrid people. Not many of the desk staff speak English so it can be quite difficult making yourself understood if you don't speak Spanish, but on the whole, this didn't spoil our experience and I would definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Booked online for great price, pleasantly surprised how nice a stay it was”
Reviews.Author: JessiWhite84
Reviews.Content: I booked Tryp Cibeles through good reviews on Trip Advisor and booked it on hotels.com. My partner and I were on a smaller budget, so were willing to accept we would "get what we paid for." I believe it was $87 a night (American $), which to me is extremely cheap. We struggled to find the hotel despite my very detailed Google Maps picture, notes, etc. Once we found it, though, we went to the 1st Floor, checked in, went up to our room and I was shocked. My hotel experiences in Europe have never been impressive. Tiny rooms, big ticket price, not impressed. This room was American sized! Big bed, lots of space, tons of light (we had a balcony room with ceiling to floor windows). The bathroom was huge with a full tub and shower. All toiletry items were already in the room. This place was far more than what we expected. They also cleaned it every day. The location is great. I knew nothing of Madrid and we fortunately were in a perfect and convenient area right off of Gran Via one block (or two) from the Metro 5 train (which we later learned we could take to the airport -- definitely take the train to/from the airport!!!!). Many reviews are complaining of noise, but I live in New York City (even in a quiet area) and I didn't have a problem with the street noise. Madrid beat Barcelona one night we were there, so sure, it's going to be noisy. Whatever. We're in Spain. It's to be expected. We didn't use the concierge services nor did we partake in breakfast, so I can't report on that. All-in-all though, for the price we paid, it was outstanding and I will guaranteed consider Tryp Cibeles on my return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous location, noisy at night.”
Reviews.Author: JulieMarie718
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Madrid many times after studying abroad there and had never had a good hotel experience until the Tryp Cibeles. The hotel's first impressions leave little to be desired, the reception is up one floor from the main entrance, and both the ground and 1st floors were under construction. However, when walking into our triple room we were surprised to see a nice, high quality, large room and bathroom. The balcony overlooking Gran Via was great. There was one drawback- the noise at night. There is a club underneath the hotel and there are swarms of young spaniards gathering outside to get in and see the band at all hours of the night. It was a good thing that we were very tired from the days and the late dinners to not be bothered too much by the noise.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant 4* Hotel in the Heart of MADRID”
Reviews.Author: JackyYC
Reviews.Content: We love the close proximity of the hotel from the Metro. Hotel is located at the heart of gran via and is close to major attractions in Madrid. Although, the location is in a major street, we were not disturbed by the traffic noise. Rooms are standard, clean and no frills. Bathroom is really clean and spotless. we obtained the room for just 99usd (thrugh ofiicial site) and would not hesistant to stay there again when we return to Madrid. A great hotel in a great and Fun city. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel I would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Bren1234
Reviews.Content: This is the 6th time I have been in Madrid in the last 4 yrs and I have stayed in hotels for half the price that have been far superior.the 1st room they gave us reeked of cigarette smoke although they upgraded us to a room facing the gran via the window didn't close properly and the noise level at night was unbearable,had to wait to get home to get a decent nights sleep.Madrid is a fantastic and beautiful city and I most definitely will be returning but not to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location”
Reviews.Author: tonerr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tryp Cibeles during out trip to Madrid. From what i've heard about how tiny hotel rooms in Europe can be, i was pleasantly surprised how reasonably and comfortably large our room was. We booked as a triple as we were traveling with our teenage son. The room has a king size bed and a twin bed. There was enough closet space and a refrigerator,a writing desk,a tv desk, and a place where you can set your luggage down in the room. There was also a safe. The room was very clean and kept clean our entire stay. The bathroom was big and very nice! The towels are big and soft. They have nice amenities like dental kit, shaving kit, shoe mitts, comb, in case you forgot to bring one. I like that the rooms do not have carpets but have wood (laminate?) floors. It just feels cleaner to me. I hate seeing carpets stains! The beds are comfortable and the pillows are soft and plentiful. The only thing i did not like was that i felt the room was a bit too warm for my comfort but it suits my son and husband perfectly! The room included breakfast and the breakfast buffet was awesome! They have different cold cuts (of course i always get the ham!), some hot entrees that were ok, good assortment of cheeses, wonderful pastries and awesome croissants! They have amazing coffee, hot chocolates and espresso! Don't forget to try their fresh yogurt as they are delicious! Certainly none i can find back in the US ! The hotel is right in the middle of "hub" happening in madrid. It is walking distance to puerto del sol, the theater district, shops, restaurants, department stores, calle mayor, the metro (subway), and a lot of other "must see" structures. The staff are all friendly and very helpful. They will help you book trips, shows, restaurant reservations, taxi! If you go to Madrid, try this hotel. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “An okay hotel in middle of city”
Reviews.Author: TrekmanSussex
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night only, endorse earlier comments, hotel is in a great position, yes its noisy but thats Madrid, if you do not want noise then ask for a quiet room - i was offered a choice when booking in - impressed by that - if you do not want the street noise then locate a hotel in a side street there are plenty of them to choose from. Be aware that there is a main shopping street nearby frequented by streetwalkers, its all part of the experience. Room okay air con not working was told to open the window, we found the room incredibly stuffy and hard to sleep. breakfast was fine the usual affair all you can eat, and assorted meats cereals etc. the price of which included in room rate. its al;so very convenient for the Metro. the tickets cost 2 euros from the airport to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “good location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: hinaly
Reviews.Content: It is in a good location, very close to the pedestrian zones which means it can also be noisy. We stayed two nights and the first night was okay as we kept the windows closed and they seemed to be soundproof. The second day they switched off the air-conditioning. We enquired and were told " the season is over". This was Sep 21 and it was about 80 degrees F. We had to make a choice between leaving the windows open and letting all the street noises in, or sweating. By husband insisted on the former. The fact that there is a sex shop at the back of the hotel and our room overlooked a side street very close to the shop did not help. There was a drunk outside the shop shouting till 3 am. The first day we had free wi-fi, at least in the lobby. The second day I asked why I was not able to connect and was told "the rules have changed". there would be a charge - I think it was 2 euros per hour. I was willing to pay that and mentioned that I could not connect from my room. The answer was "It is available in all rooms. No one else has complained". Our guide told us that due to downturn in the economy hotels in Spain hire workers on six months contract. The staff know that they are there for just 6 months and are not bothered. We stayed in 3 other hotels in Spain on this visit but this one took the prize for indifference.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/price”
Reviews.Author: Islandgirl741
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all that it said in the ads. The standard rooms are large, and clean. All the ammenities that you would find in a US 4 star hotel. Well worth the price. I like the fact that the rooms don't have carpet, it's hardwood floors. The only down side is the internet access, it's wireless internet access and you have to pay for it 2 euros for 1 hour or 6 euros for 12 hours. Considering that Tryp is a line of hotels, this services should be free (gratis).

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION, IDEAL FOR A SHORT STAY, JUST A LITTLE NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: Kezzie80
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfect location to explore Madrid. 2 min walk to Metro station and right in the middle of city. We stayed for 3 nights which was ideal, however, because hotel is in such a busy area we did find the room very noisy at night with traffic and did get disturbed a few times throughout the night. Any longer than 3 nights and we would have been shattered through lack of sleep! Very clean, nice staff and enjoyable breakfast. Would visit again for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel on perfect place”
Reviews.Author: DuketownTraveller
Reviews.Content: We have been 4 noghts in this hotel and had a good time. Decent rooms with clean bathrooms, great beds and lots of quiet rooms available. The breakfast was very good, we missed a place to have a drink in the hotel and a nice place to spend some time in the sun. The place is perfect, next to the Gran Via and close to 2 metro stations, lots of shops and within 10 minutes you can reach Plaza Mayor and Royal Palace. Lots of restaurants and bars on walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but basically located in Red Light District”
Reviews.Author: supr_dave23
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine. Service was good, price was reasonable. I booked this hotel specifically because it said it was near downtown and in the shopping district. It is, there are lots of shops and theaters and shows on Gran Via. However, there are also about 1000 extremely aggressive prostitutes a couple of streets over from the hotel and also right behind the hotel. Don't be a single man after dark unless you are in the market for a prostitute, because they are aggressive and will basically grab you and give the hard sell. Its annoying. Also, AC in the room did not work, but it was relatively cold when I was there so was only a minor annoyance. The walls are also thin and there is quite a bit of noise from other rooms and the street. Those issues are why I rate the sleep quality lower.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe, Unfriendly, Unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: gzicherm
Reviews.Content: I had fond memories of staying at the Tryp Cibeles, until tonight. Booked a reasonably priced, and quite clean room at this centrally located hotel. But from the minute I arrived, everything was "impossible". The energy from the staff was palpably unhelpful, and it didn't get any better. First off, the power outlets in my room made a sparking/arcing whenever my new macbook was plugged in. After this happened a couple of times, I stopped using it, but now I think it ruined my charging adapter. Secondly, my room has a window that faces the hallway of the hotel, but no proper curtains. So, when I'm asleep, you can clearly see into my room from the hallway. When I called the front desk to try and rectify the curtain issue, the staffer told me that he didn't speak english (seriously!) so, in my halting Spanish I told him that the situation was not ok and his suggestion was - in a hostile manner - that I should call tomorrow. A quick call to their reservation center and the woman on the phone tells me that all the SolMelia hotels in Madrid are fully booked (without actually running a query). So, isn't this super nice? A 4 star business-class hotel in the center of Madrid with the service, amenities and safety of a 2 star in Mumbai. Really glad I chose to stay here again. Oh, and as the topper - the paid internet is among the slowest I have ever used in my whole life.

Reviews.Title: “On Grand Via close to shopping, restaurant and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: tiskand
Reviews.Content: Surrounded by shops and restaurants. Very convenient. Internet not free but 6 Euros for 12 hours. Goo breakfast. (However the area seems to be the hangout for "ladies of the night" !)

Reviews.Title: “Very central, cleaned, good price”
Reviews.Author: QuickandGoodReviews
Reviews.Content: Didn't like the prostitutes in the nearby area, didn't like the lobby on the 3rd floor. Liked: it was cheap, the room was spacious and nice. Bathrooms are small with ok amenities. Breakfast: quite good with big selection. Very busy sometimes. We spent 5 nights there. In the end we felt at home. The bed was extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...but that's about all!”
Reviews.Author: User0910
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect - situated right on the Gran Via in the centre of town. However that was about all that impressed us about the hotel! We found our room ok late at night, the room was clean and the bathroom was adequate. But the beds were so hard and uncomfortable (usually i love a firm mattress but this was taking the cake!), and they were two twin beds pushed together, with an uncomfortable join in the middle! God forbid if i wanted to go near my husband in the night...the tightly made-up sheets and the join in the beds prevented any closeness!!!!!!! Furthermore, at 8am, they started playing this unbearable hotel muzak - at top volume! on investigation, my husband found that there were speakers situated right outside our bedroom door - why there has to be music playing outside BEDROOMS i dont know! it was an unwelcome wake-up call! we had got to bed at 1am and to be woken at 8 on our holiday, where we had come to relax, was not our idea of restful. The music was also playing until 11pm, which prevented any early nights. To be fair, when asked (three times) the reception did eventually turn down the volume of the music, but even at its minimum volume it was audible. The hotel front desk was hit-and-miss. If you got the right person for the job, they were polite, well-informed and reasonable. however if you got the night-shift fellow, he was surly, inefficient and uninformed. All in all, it wasnt a BAD place to stay, but certainly wasnt somewhere we'd go back to in a hurry. Find somewhere else if you want a COMFORTABLE restful stay! As a disclaimer, i will add that as i'm pregnant, comfort and sleep were very important to me on this trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great price”
Reviews.Author: MR_PHL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tryp Cibeles in early October and found it to be a nice, well-located hotel. We purchased the room at an unusually good rate from Travelocity. It was close to or over $200 on other hotel sites. But we paid around $118 which beat anything for similar quality on Priceline or Hotwire. Location: Central Madrid, right on the Gran Via. The hotel is midway between Gran Via and Callao on the Metro. If you don't want the inconvenience of changing trans, you should consider a cab from the airport as both stations require two stops. Which every station you come out, if you look down the Gran Via, you can see a sign that says Tryp Cibeles on the side of a building. The hotel entrance is down a small alley. There is a guard who has a list of all arriving guests. He will check your ID. The check in is one floor up. The alley is not some dank scary alley if that's what you are thinking. There are a lot of tables belonging to the eatery next door. One of the best locations I could imagine. A short walk to the Prado, Royal Palace, Opera, Puerta del Sol. If you want to walk, you can. If you want to take the subway, buy an “Abono Turistico” at the airport subway station. The passes are good for one or two days and are a great bargain. Check-in: Very quick and easy. Check is in 12:00 and we got in a bit early. They had no problems accommodating us in a King Room. The staff speaks decent English. They require all hotels guests to provide ID so have passports for everyone available. Room: Cozy and clean. Our room did not face the Gran Via which may be the source of some of the noise complaints on other review. We had ZERO problems with noise in our room. Please keep in mind that in order to turn on the lights, you have to slip your key card into a socket on the wall. Nothing works otherwise. The air conditioner works a bit slowly and the room was pretty stuffy until it got going. The “king bed” was really two twins pushed together. Didn't really cause a problem, but its something one should be aware of. We had plenty of closet space. The room has a safe, TV, refrigerator. The fridge is always a nice touch in case we want to get some fruit or cold cuts at the market. There is in-room internet if you have a computer with you. The floors are linoleum with tile in the bath. The bath was nice but dark. My wife mentioned that putting on makeup was difficult. The hotel provides hand soap, shaving kit, dental kit and shower cap. Bath soap and shampoo were in a dispenser inside the shower. Plenty of towels. Service: I thought it was quite good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They will help with restaurant reservations and directions. The guard downstairs had no problems remembering our faces after we first met him. I would not use the internet cafe in the lobby if you are going to spend a lot of time on it. One desk clerk pointed out that the Zahara coffee shop across the street has an internet cafe on the second floor and its a bit cheaper. We did not get food in the hotel There is a supermarket in the department store at Callao metro where we bought small things for breakfast. The restaurant next door has decent pizzas and other items and is relatively affordable. Overall: We were very pleased. The location is second to none. We had no problems with noise. There were hookers roaming around the alley, although at the far end of the street is a sex shop which may or may not be your style. Everything was comfortable and the staff did a good job for us. The price we got was outstanding and if you can find this price, you are getting a nice deal.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid "interesting" location”
Reviews.Author: gadflyUk
Reviews.Content: Tremendous central location. Museums, palaces, parks and shops all walkable. Great metro. Large building with frontage onto Via Grande. 6th floor rooms have small balcony with spectacular vertiginous views but this comes with the constant roar of this vibrant city that rocks till 3am every night. The double gazing can't cope with the racket so take ear plugs.You can attempt to opt for quieter internal facing rooms.Large atrium reminiscent of a Roman baths with bar and breakfast room. Throughout, the hotel is fairly well presented and solid with good domestic services. Internet, TV, fridge and safe. Entrance through a side street with concierge (guard) and lifts - roomy and efficient - to Reception. It's in a 'belles de nuit' area but openess and matter-of-fact is the order of the day in mad beautiful Madrid and the punters, girls, traffic, shops and the crowd are all one homogenous mass with no feeling of sleaze really. Indeed, the ladies patrol about during the day and appear and act quite respectfully. Smashing varied restaurants catering to all wallets and tastes. Loads of bars, theatres, cinemas, shops etc in hotel area. Hotel breakfast was usual quirky "european" melange of pasteries, meats, cheeses, sausages, eggs, etc but was nothing spectacular. We caught a rather rubbery cold scrambled egg presentation one morning and very over boiled sausages-the food is on display from 7-11am. No restaurant and the bar is very quiet; the waiter is called by telephoning from the bar! Nippy hotel booze prices unfortunately. Business types and mixed tourists for clients which included infants and a troup of japanesse folk who wore anti-flu masks which provided the breakfadst cabaret when it came to drinking their coffee. Rooms medium sized with good storage space, air conditioning, shower/bath and good lightproof curtains.The hotel itself is modestly quiet internally. Utterly fabulous art museums and parks. The architecture everywhere is unbelievable. Pickpockets and dismal "information" centres (tourist and airport metro for example were hopeless) were disappointing in this roaring, robust, vibrant,beatiful,gritty,modern city. Go with the flow or you'll go under and hate it. Otherwise, get in the mood and you'll have a ball. Finally, we didn't find it expensive. Oh, and the airport is terrific with a super metro system into town....but watch out for the (sometimes amateurish) thieves.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, nice room.”
Reviews.Author: tomaburgess
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Tryp Cibeles just off the Gran Via and have to say I was more than pleasantly surprised. After having read some of the other reviews of it on here before I went I had some apprehension. The hotel couldn't be in a better location to accessing the best parts of Madrid on foot, the staff I dealt with were all very friendly and happily brought up several items I requested within minutes (bottle opener, ice, etc). I would definitely return to Tryp Cibeles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room with a wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: mandub8
Reviews.Content: Ok first things first. I got a really good rate for this room and am a member of the Melia programme so might have got a better room than the other reviewers here (but I doubt it!) The room was BIG, The bed really large and very comfortable. The bathoom was decent size (I brough my own products so the didn't have to use the one provided!) Nice touches included a shaving kit, There is internter access in the room - you sign a voucher at reception and the hourly charge is reasonable. What absolutely made trhe room rhough was the view fromthe balcony. I was on the 6th floor and there was a cute balcony with a view over the Grand Via and the historic area of the city. It was stunning. Word of caution for the squamish/young familes - the side street the hoitel is accessed from does have some hookers - there's a red light area a few streets back. Didn't bother me but some families may not like this. The door man of the hotel was a nice security touch though,

Reviews.Title: “Most Horrible Hotel For Service”
Reviews.Author: whitem4
Reviews.Content: While the room was large and clean, this was the worst hotel stay in our lives, especially for the money. Service was horrible, room service non-existent, conflicting stories on internet access. Access was horrible because of construction,and don't go two doors over away from the main street as you will be on hooker row.

Reviews.Title: “we were robbed at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda46
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in jan 08 as one of the stops on our honeymoon. We returned one day after sightseeing to find all our cash taken form the hotel safe. We had locked the safe and chosen our own pin number, so whoever did this was definetly staff!. I have sent numerous emails to the hotel manager and to the hotel chain and have had no reply!. I would definetly not recommend this hotel no matter how close it is to the city centre. I was expecting to get robbed in madrid but not from my hotel safe!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, quiet and well-run”
Reviews.Author: Pearlcat
Reviews.Content: Of all the three-star and four-star hotels my family stayed at during a recent European trip, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel the most. The location is outstanding. It is half a block off the Gran Via. It is a two-clock walk to the Callao metro station, but we didn't use it as we walked to every major tourist attraction except the Prado, which is on the opposite end of downtown. The shopping near the hotel was excellent. The breakfast was generous and varied. Some guests have complained about street noise. Our room overlooked the hyper-busy Gran Via, and when the double windows were closed, the room was silent. Our street-front room room was large, light-filled and superclean, as was the bathroom. This hotel was an island of cleanliness and quiet. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: carolkParadise
Reviews.Content: What a great location right in the center of Madrid. The entrance is on a side street that was not very clean but once you are in the hotel it is very nice. Very quiet room overlooking an atrium. Don't miss the roof top views of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Glynis_2004
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel, following the many positive reviews I had read on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. On arrival at Madrid airport, take the Metro (2 Euros) to Puerto del Sol and the Gran Via is straight in front of you with El Cortes Ingles to your left We spent 4 nights at this hotel during April and were made to feel most welcome and notably, being frequent city break travellers, it is by far the nicest hotel that we have stayed in to date. Its position on The Gran Via means that it is a fantastic location to see all of Madrid, a vibrant city that never sleeps. Close by are very reasonable restaurants, bars, shops and the Metro - but recommend sight seeing on foot because there really is just so much to see! This hotel provides the most fantastic breakfast, ranging from breakfast cereals, assorted breads, meat, pate, cheese and jams. Our room (501) was spacious, kept spotlessly clean by our very courteous chamber maids and with clean bed linen and towels supplied every day. We even had our own balcony which overlooked the side of the hotel and we were not bothered by the noise of the traffic at all There was also a mini-bar supplying various drinks / snacks and a very spacious marble bathroom with a nice selection of toiletries etc. The staff were all very helpful and spoke excellent English, helping us plan our daily excursions in such a truly beautiful city. Turning left up the Gran Via you can then meander your way through the Paseo del Prado and then marvel at the fantastic artwork in the Museo del Prado and Reina Sofia. At the other end of the city you have the Cathedral and Palace with its priceless collections of paintings, furniture and tapestries. Madrid can be expensive but we found some lovely inexpensive eating places dotted around the city. Try a leisurely walk along Paseo de Recoletas where cafes have their own terraces with their tempting tapas selection There was so much to see and do in Madrid that a return trip may even be called for. For value for money we would definitely stay at this hotel again. Outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jk_traveler20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really in the center of Madrid - walking distance to everywhere! I don't think we used the metro once. The accomodations are basic and the room and the bathroom are very small but clean. The view from our room was beautiful. The hotel also has a fantastic breakfast buffett that kept us full all day long. Overall, we thought the hotel was very nice for the price and we enjoyed our stay. The only thing that I can never get used to are the 2 twin beds pulled together - what's wrong with having one queen matress?

Reviews.Title: “Some trust issues at this hotel! Watch your valuables”
Reviews.Author: ProfGregg
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to say that the Tryp Cibeles is a pleasatn hotel, that is clean and has a good breakfast. It is centrally located but very noisy if you are directly on the Grand Via. Secondly, there are some serious security issues with this hotel. We had several things taken from our rooms and we actually found our chambermaids gloves INSIDE my suitcase, which she obviously had been rooting around in. We complained to the fron staff about the thefts and they did nothing. We complained to the hotel ownership directly, including pictures of the gloves inside my suitcase and we received no reply. With t his said, I would strongly recommend against staying in this hotel. The internal security issues, combined with the fact that the hotel's rear is right smack in the middle of Madrid's prostitution street would prevent me from ever wanting to stay here again. We didn't feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: VSPE
Reviews.Content: We spend three nights in hotel over Thanksgiving weekend. We were offered oversized room for an additional 16 euro per night. The room was on the fifth floor on the corner with Gran Via. Room was clean and nice, but really typical for european hotels. The bathroom was spotless. The TV was kind small for my liking, but we did not have time to watch it. There are some noise coming from Gran Via, which can be kind loud at night, but it is on the same level with New York City. Hotel was booked directly thru Sol Melia website.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pretty basic accomodations”
Reviews.Author: CharlieL1957
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on the Gran Via, 200 yards from the Gran Via and Collao (sp ?) metro stops. Entrance on a side street, small lobby, helpful desk clerks. Room was small, nicely furnished, bathroom fairly modern. I had a tiny balcony on the Gran Via . . . very neat, particularly at night. Didn't mind the street noise. Lots of sleazy looking / acting people (that approach you for money and whatever) near the hotel, but they didn't seem threatening. Would stay elsewhere unless you get a great deal on the price. But, I used Hotwire and Priceline for 4 nights in Madrid. Also stayed at Tryp Ambassador for the same $65 - 70.00 (an excellent price). The Ambassador is a far superior hotel, equally good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: amwerewolfinlondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a small entrance off Gran Via. The location is excellent for tourists. Just be wary of pick pockets. The hotel reception was a tiny desk and not always manned. The room was in good condition and we requested one with a balcony overlooking the Gran Via (see pictures). We only had tea at the hotel but it was good. Not a bad place to stay if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, everything ok”
Reviews.Author: patsyc216
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our 2 nights stay at Tryp Cibeles last night. Overall it was a pleasant stay and we enjoyed our short break in Madrid. The good points first: 1. The hotel is less than 1 min walk from Callao Metro station and basically you could walk to all attractions from this base. 2. The rooms are spacious, clean and beds are comfortable. 3. Breakfast buffet is good with a mix of hot and cold choices. Now the not so good points: 1. One of the rooms we were allocated was along the Gran Via which gave us great photos opportunities, but for the guy who stayed in the room it was not so great. He was kept awake by the sirens and noisy street crowds into the early hours and he had to buy ear plugs for the 2nd night stay. We had 2 rooms around the side of the building one of which I stayed in and being a light sleeper I had no trouble staying asleep at all! So that's something to bear in mind when booking a room. 2. Check-in was extremely slow and almost painful worsen by the fact that the website we booked our rooms with had given the wrong guest name to the hotel for one of the rooms. I think in total check-in took almost 30 mins! 3. They tried to charge us for breakfast even though the guy at check-in had confirmed we had breakfast included for the 1st morning. We refused to pay and told the breakfast guy to check with the receptionist. 2nd morning we ate at Vips down the road and that was a perfectly decent breakfast without all the hassle. Would I return to this hotel? Yes, I would for its great location and good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Tryp”
Reviews.Author: senoraylan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of January for my husband's 40th. We booked on the Sol Melia website & got a very good deal of €84 per night room only. The hotel is situated up a street just off the Gran Via & you have to take a lift to reception, probably not the easiest to find if you are arriving on foot, but we got a taxi & got dropped off at the door. There is a security guard on the downstairs door who checks who is going in & out (good for security). Checking in was quick & easy, very professional & pleasant staff. We had asked for a room with a terrace & view of the Gran Via (it said on the website when booking that you had to pay more for these rooms but we got it for the standard rate) & we were allocated a corner room on the 5th floor with 2 terraces & fantastic views up & down the Gran Via, looking towards the Plaza d'Espana you could see the snow covered mountains in the distance. Unfortunately it was too cold to make use of the terraces, but worth it for the views. The room was clean & welcoming and the air con when turned on warmed the room nicely. It was a typical Tryp room with firm but comfortable beds, wi fi internet access (small charge) mini bar & very nice bathroom. Nothing exciting, but pleasant enough. The only downside was that, although the windows were double glazed, it wasn't enough & the sound of sirens did wake us up. Oh, well, one of the drawbacks of staying on the Gran Via! We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, so can't comment on the standard of food. Check out at 4.50 in the morning was swift & efficient & the taxi that we had asked reception to order for us the night before was waiting. All in all a pleasant stay in a central hotel with efficient, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Tryp Terriblis”
Reviews.Author: KatyL
Reviews.Content: We were attending a concert on the outskirts of Madrid and chose this hotel for its central location, to explore the city in the daytime. Location was central if a little touristy, am sure there are better hotels to be found in this range in Madrid. Our room was ridiculoulsly hot for the cool March weather with only an internal window to ventilate. Uncomfortable bed, basic bathroom, noisy in the morning as room was adjacent to the atrium of the hotel where they served breakfast. Only saving grace was that the breakfast and service were good.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cat_in_Rabat
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money: friendly staff, great location (just off the Grand Via & half a block from the metro), and huge room. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Tryp Cibeles”
Reviews.Author: Traveler01234
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! The room was very clean and quiet. I enjoyed my stay there for 6 nights. The staff were very friendly and helpful; highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ekim_zus
Reviews.Content: We have just spent three nights over Christmas at the Tryp Cibeles. We really enjoyed our stay there. The staff were excellent, they gave us a fantastic room looking out onto the Gran Via even though we only booked a standard room. The room was spacious and clean. Whilst for a four star hotel, the furnishings and finishings were probably not as luxurious as other four star hotels we have stayed in but other factors push up the desirability of this hotel. It is excellent value for money - we paid £62 per night including breakfast. The location is great, right in the centre of Madrid and within walking distance of many sights. The metro is very easy to use - and cheap! Train from the airport cost us 1 euro each. Unfortunately the only downfall of our room was that there was constant noise from traffic, sirens and horns which did not let up all night long. The beds were firm but we found them comfortable. The shower in the bathroom was fab. Breakfast was good, fair amount of choice and also available from 7am-11am. When paying by credit card on check out it gives you the option to pay in sterling or euros, this is an option given by the credit card company. The exchange rate was excellent so we chose to pay in sterling. We were given this option in many retail outlets in Spain when paying by paying by credit card. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the second time”
Reviews.Author: gfgar
Reviews.Content: it is the second time i was at trip cibeles. location is excellent. breakfast is very good and with tipical spanish speciality. the rooms are very well equipped , not very large indeed but the most of them have a special view on the gran via. the bathroom is large and functional the entrance is on a street few metres from the gran via, it is small ,isn't an hall but only a litlle security check point the hall is on the first floor you reach with the elevator. it is brightly and modern furnished. i stongly raccomanded this hotel togheter my friends

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great spot!!”
Reviews.Author: IheartNY082
Reviews.Content: The Tryp Cibeles is a really great hotel, and good value for the money at that. The location is totally perfect, with convenient Metro stops nearby, and is a quick walk to Puerta del Sol. Everything about Madrid was wonderful, and staying at the Tryp Cibeles only enhanced it.
