I would definitely recommend the hotel, and definitely the city, for any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dublinview
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel at end of September for 5 nights and could not fault it on any level. The room was lovely and spacious, with excellent bathroom and large comfortable beds. We were on the 2nd floor of hotel at the front, which is actually 5 floors up as hotel over a huge Zara shop! There was a lovelt balcony overlooking the Gran Via which was brilliant and although noisy at times with the doors open, it was completely sound-proof once you close them. Breakfast was gorgeous - huge buffet with lots of choice. Location was perfect - we didn't need public transport once - everywhere was lovely walk away and area seemed very safe. I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very good breakfast, lovely building, hard beds”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromCanada
Reviews.Content: Sol Melia, the parent company for this hotel, has summer specials at cheap rates. In 2005, we got a twin room at this hotel for 68 Euros plus 7% tax, including an excellent buffet breakfast, which is available until 11. The entrance is slight, and the doorpeople do not speak much English, but once you are in the check-in area, you can see that the hotel is lovely. The breakfast area/bar has cathedral style ceilings. The room has parquet floors and is very pleasant and not small, an important consideration in Europe. The air-conditioning worked very well in August in 100F heat. The bathroom was gorgeous, and there were huge bath towels, more like beach wrap size. The buffet breakfast is an extensive high-quality spread. Two drawbacks: * The beds are on the hard side. This did not bother me, but it did bother my daughter. * If you pay by credit card, the staff will try to push through dynamic currency conversion. Read up on this - it's not a good deal to be charged in your own currency. If you are up for a fight, insist on being charged in Euros. Otherwise, pay cash.

Reviews.Title: “Just a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kezoh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights at the end of September and I have to say it was a pleasure. Got a lovely room on the seventh floor at the back of the hotel which was very quiet and had panoramic views of the city skyline. Nice sized bathroom too with a great power shower. The staff were extremely courteous and friendly. The breakfast was lovely every morning. The hotel's location is absolutely brilliant - you are so central for everything. I would advise anyone visiting Madrid to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: alwaysgone50
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice - we asked for a higher floor, not on the street as others has suggested and it was very quiet, but also was not over the weekend. The breakfast was included in our rate and very good - the orange juice machine was awesome and the best oj I've ever had. We bought the hop on hop off bus pass and the pick up was right outside. We also purchased some tours and they picked up at our hotel also. Overall very satisfied with the value for money we received

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fab room”
Reviews.Author: Boreda
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a short break to Madrid where we stayed at the Tryp Cibeles. The hotel had an excellent location on the gran via and our room had a balcony overlooking this main street which was great for people watching, although a little noisy on the saturday night (nothing earplugs couldn't easily block out!). The room was very spacious and had a lovely bathroom. The air conditioning provided welcome relief from the heat of the June sun and all in all was a great place to chill out. Staff in the hotel were very friendly and ready to help. And breakfast was excellent with fresh orange and a lovely selection of fruits, cereals, hams, cheeses and tortilla. Madrid was a funky city although wouldn't recommend the city tour as you can easily get around the nice bits on foot. Took a tour round the Bernabau stadium which is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: billyandme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tryp Cibeles for a few days before taking a highlight bus tour of Spain and Portugal this past May 2006. This was not the hotel that was part of the tour. We booked it thru Travelocity for E101/night. The hotel is situated directly on the Grand Via with a side street guarded entrance. We found the area and the hotel to be extremely safe, even at midnight. The price included breakfast which was fabulous. The room was 609 and had a great view of the Grand Via with a small balcony. The hotel is located right in the mdddle of all the hubbub of Madrid, and has a ton of restaurants and shopping in the area as well. The room was quiet even though it was on a main throughfare, and the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The service was very accomodating as well. The double deck tour bus picks you up a few steps from the hotel. We bought our tickets on the bus, but you can buy them at the hotel. Remember, if you are a senior, you get a special price. Great way to get around town. I highly recommend this hotel for a Madrid holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: berni725
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here in April 06 and it was only a 7 Euro cab ride from main train station. Centrally located and within 15 minute walk to central locations. Only 5 minute walk to local metro station. We purchased an all day pass and went many places. Right in heart of "Time Square" location. Many things close by. We had a very friendly staff and spacious room. We even had a nice balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: nvukovlj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the hotel over a weekend in March. The room and the bathroom were clean and well appointed. The staff at the hotel were friendly. The location of the hotel - very central, close to a lot of Madrid's attractions and in the main shopping district make it ideal for anyone wishing to explore Madrid on foot as well as getting some shopping in on the way back. We had a room overlooking Gran Via which even had a small balcony. The noise wasn't a problem but to be honest this was more to do with us keeping the windows closed (the weather wasn't that warm). Had this been in summer I can appreciate that noise would be an issue. Overall, very happy with the hotel. It was pretty good value (approx euro 120 per night - booked directly on their website) with exception that the breakfast wasn't included and the charge for hotel breakfast is euro 25 per person which is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Tryp Cibeles and Madrid”
Reviews.Author: solchica
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Madrid (and definately not our last!), the hotel Cibeles was perfectly placed in the centre of Madrid on the Gran Via. The hotel was lovely, the staff where very friendly and helpful. The room was also really nice, the bathroom was smart and the whole room was clean and very comfortable. The breakfast in the hotel was delicious and caters for all tastes. The only little niggle (but not really a complaint) was that it was sometimes difficult to get a drink at the bar which was left unmaned but this wasn't a problem as there are so many bars close to the hotel. All in all, we would definately return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellant location in the heart of madrid. Rooms spacious, clean, bathroom excellant. Booked on advice from tripadvisors reviews. However on the edge of the red light district. When you leave hotel turn right not left. Excellent shopping, cafes, and theatre. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service--Jose Luis is the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family Nov. 14-18, 2005 and the location is perfect, bus station in front, near the shopping area, hotel is close to everything. Rooms are large, clean, breakfast is super, have a large variety of food and price is very good, better than restaurants around. Employees are attentive, corteous and efficient. Best employee is Jose Luis at the front desk, he helped me with a package I left behind. Jose Luis is an example of excellent customer service. It is very safe to walk around. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I reeeally liked it.”
Reviews.Author: SingleTripper
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here this week. I used the hotel as a home base to see all of Madrid, Escorial, etc etc. This was by far the nicest hotel I stayed in while in Spain for two weeks. Location: Gran Via is great. It's Times Squar-ish, without the grime. Restaurants, shopping, metro, all within spitting distance from the hotel. I didn't feel unsafe for a second. That said, I'm a 27-yr-old guy. Also, I wouldn't wander north from there at midnight, but you probably already knew that. Room: Wow. Seriously, this was the nicest room I had while in the country. Marble bathrooms, roomy, I was completely comfortable here. Staff: The staff spoke passable English, although it wasn't the best I encountered. I didn't have any problems. Internet: This is slightly shady, as the solmedia website led me to believe that the rooms had Internet connections. Not so, only the lobby does, and even then they charge you for it. After a few of these experiences in various cities, I decided that Internet access in a Spanish hotel room is just not probable or even necessary. Too much sighseeing to do anyway. Food: Didn't eat the hotel food, but you're in a great neighborhood, so go out and find anything you want! Overall, I really would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not great value for money though”
Reviews.Author: hawkipa
Reviews.Content: After staying in a Melia hotel in Valencia and seeing this was part of the same group along with reviews here, we booked in: Price: Seemed about average for Madrid Location: Excellent, getting to the airport from here was a 1 euro trip! Hotel: Rooms well appointed, although we originally had one overlooking the internal courtyard on what felt like a double campbed, which was very small. However, we moved onto one overlooking the Gran Via which was so much bigger and better. The noise was not a problem at all for me and im not the heaviest sleeper in the world. The staff: very nice. The concierge guy was really helpful, giving me advice on all sorts and even looking after my car to make sure i didnt get a ticket. No breakfast though, which was a bummer given it was E150 a night. However, cafe & te just down the road do a very cheap breakfast. Theres no parking at all though, but that seems par for the course in the city centre. Overall I would recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but less impressed with the Cibeles than other reviewers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a short stay at the Tryp Cibeles in October 2005, on the strength of the reviews we had read here. As others have mentioned, the reception desk is on the first floor. Upon our arrival, we were greeted in the ground floor lobby by an elderly doorman who understood zero English, and who guarded the entrance to his territory jealously and refused to let us pass! His attitude was spectacularly unhelpful, and it quickly became clear that he lacked either the initiative or the inclination to fetch somebody from reception who understood English. It took a good 5-10 minutes of politely insisting that we had a reservation in our rudimentary and poorly accented Spanish, during which time he became progressively ruder and ruder, before the penny finally dropped that we were indeed bona fide guests, rather than a band of ruffians masquerading as middle class English people. Once we did manage to actually make it to reception the staff did make us very welcome; however, this was not a good start, and for a 4 star hotel we felt it was a bit poor to entrust the greeting of hotel guests to a graduate of the Basil Faulty school of customer service training. On the plus side: Great location, and very nicely appointed and comfortable rooms which were spotlessly clean. On the minus side: We had rooms facing the Gran Via, and although the noise didn't bother me, it kept some of the other people I travelled with awake. When I tried to register my MAS card upon arrival (which would have entitled the second person in each room we had booked to a free breakfast during our stay) the person I spoke to in reception insisted that it had to be done when we checked out. (So: did we get the free breakfasts? Nope.) When we checked out, the mini-bar tab also appeared on our bill twice, and it took quite a bit of persuasion to convince the hotel of this and get them to adjust it. Our attempts to have a drink in the bar on the first night were also frustrated by the fact that it was unstaffed. After hanging around for 20 minutes waiting to be served, we gave up and didn't bother again for the rest of our stay. In conclusion: As this was our first trip to Madrid, we had no other hotels in the city to compare it with. However, compared to other 4 star hotels in general, and 4 star hotels owned by the same chain we've stayed at in the past, the service was rather hit and miss and we wouldn't choose to stay there again for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: frandy
Reviews.Content: Best thing about the hotel is its location. It's just off the Gran Via - one of the main streets of Madrid. Easy walking distance to Puerto del Sol and Plaza Mayor and not too far from the Royal Palace. Metro station right outside which was easy to use and a very cheap way of exploring Madrid. Reception is on the first floor, staff were very helpful and spoke great English. It was very nice, but not quite the 4 star advertised. Our room was spotlessly clean - the towels and linen changed every day. The only minus point was that the air conditioning for the hotel had been switched off and the heating switched on from October 29 desipite the average outside temperature of 19 degrees or so. Perfect weather for walking around outside but it was very warm in the hotel even with the window open. Our room didn't have a view at all, the window opened into the centre of the service area. We booked through Expedia, and had to pay the hotel rather than Expedia. All in all not a bad hotel, I would recommend it, but would check on the air con and view/window option before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: deanam
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful property—the best Gran Via establishment we have ever stayed in in many trips to Madrid. First, here are the few negatives about this hotel--fuzzy reception on a couple TV channels, slow sink drainage (impeding the washing of clothes), poor bathroom lighting with no lights at all over tub/shower; and on one morning of our stay, breakfast time was overwhelmed and there were a lot of shortages and non-existent items (eggs, for example). The MaS Rewards card (available from SolMelia) gives two-for-one breakfast (if not already included in the rate), but it was a little hassle setting up and the desk people wanted us to take breakfast everyday to make billing easier on them, no problem since the feast is a bargain at 12 euros. Charro, a security lady at ground level (reception is on the 1st floor), was most helpful with recommendations—speaking Spanish helps in this case. One was for the Puerto Rico restaurant—two blocks away on Chinchilla—very reasonable and fresh cooked set menus and ala carte listings. We ate there three of six nights in Madrid—our waitress was a native English speaker from the Philippines, named Baby. Also we had our traditional meal of roasted suckling pig at La Botin, world’s oldest restaurant, just off Plaza Mayor; we have eaten there many times during the past 40 years but this time we were disappointed in the food, presentation, and the place in general. Also don’t expect to find non-smoking areas in restaurants although such are supposedly now required. Getting to the Tryp Cibeles on the metro is possible as others have mentioned, but it is not easy with luggage. There are two transfers. After the first one at Ministerios (new, modern station), there are no lifts and not enough of the stairs are escalators. The information lady at the Barajas metro station indicated the trip was easy and although there were no lifts after Ministerios, there were escalators (yes, some). Thank heavens some young people assisted us occasionally toting luggage up and down the many stairs where there were no escalators. We took a cab back to the airport for 19 euros when we departed. If I wanted to save a little on cab fare from Barajas, I would try taking the metro to Ministerios and then a cab from there; going to the airport, I would consider taking a taxi to Ministerios and then metro to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Spain, where we spent 2 nights in the Tryp Cibeles. The hotel was extremely clean, neutrally decorated, and the staff were pleasant. We had a nice, large, pleasantly decorated and spotlessly clean room on the sixth floor. There was a nice view over the rooftops of the city. Despite being on Gran Via, the double glazing was exceptionally effective. We were also impressed that there was a card to indicate anything you weren't happy with to housekeeping (one of the lightbulbs in our room needed changing and the "card on door" system worked). The best feature of the room, though, was the bathroom. It was huge! Lovely marble fixtures, big towels, powerful shower and bath. By far the best things, though, about the hotel are: 1) the location, which is right in the city centre, very well served with metro stations, and the ideal place for visiting all that Madrid has to offer; and 2) the price! A couple of very minor things ... the smoke detector immediately over the bed had a flashing light on it which could not be switched off. Also would not recommend straying into the area immediately behind the hotel north of Gran Via. It gets pretty unpleasant pretty quickly! Finally there was a pay TV card next to the bed advertising a selection of 12 movies, 6 of which were "adult only", one of which had a pretty nasty title. I found this a bit distasteful, and it certainly isn't something you'd want to find if you had children with you. Small points, though, as it was an ideal base for a fantastic 2 days in Madrid ... and very reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: “Just a basic 4*”
Reviews.Author: Mag_Mile_Girl
Reviews.Content: A very basic 4* hotel in a very good location. Spacious room size comparing to most of European 4* hotels. Very clean room, clean bed and staffs really do work to keep them clean everyday. Beds are really hard. Staff at the front desk are very helpful. Buffet breakfast is nothing outstanding but has good spread of variety and good enough to fill up energy for the good part of morning and early afternoon. Again staff at breakfast are excellent. Overall, this hotel defines the basics of a 4* hotel and there is nothing more one can expect out of the basic, although it'd be nice. There was something odd during my stay, I noticed there were more men than women stayed in the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: kit_kat74
Reviews.Content: Very nice, large rooms with a great view of the Gran Via. At night Madrid comes alive with drum beats and people. I am a light sleeper and so I was a little concerned but once the windows were closed the the noise was greatly reduced. The beds were very comfortable and the staff was very helpful with my questions. The hotel is very close to the Metro although there are many shops within walking distance of the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: AXM723
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 7 nights. It was very nice, clean hotel and room. Very centrally located on the Gran Via. short walk to the Metro. 1 Euro per trip or you can get a metro pass. Short walk Puerta Del Sol, Plaza Mayor, and the Royal palace. Tour of Royal Palace worth the price, I think 9, or 12 Euros. Prado was a very pleasant walk from hotel, go to Plaza Cibeles and turn right. Half day tour of Toledo also recommended. If you have a digital camera where you can turn off flash, it will be great for taking pictures in Palace, Churches, and Prado. Good shoes recommended great walking city. I loved it and the hotel helped keep the positive attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few days on our honeymoon. The rooms were very nicely furnished and large for European hotels. It is also located very close to a metro stop and is within walking distance of a lot of nice restaurants. I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stu_Pidtexan91
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on other reviews and all were right. It is in a great location as a base for everything in the central Madrid and everything else is reachable with the Metro. The room was great, we were on the second floor facing the side (hotel front) away from Gran Via. The rooms are set up so traffic noise is not heard (double windows). The only noise we heard (minimal) was from the dining room below and it was not a big deal. The second floor is open to it, all others are not. The food & drink prices at the hotel were typical for any hotel. The staff was very helpful in suggesting places to eat in the area. The only complaint was that the fridge in our room didn't get cold (but it could have been set for typical europen temperature - warm!). I would definatly go back and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Peach21
Reviews.Content: This hotel easily gets a 10/10 for location as it is a fantastic base to explore the city. It's easy to get to from the airport by train. The room was clean and had great views. The room amenities were good and the bed linen was of a noticeably high standard. I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly. clean centrally located hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: gnrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in October 2003. The hotel is right on the Gran Via above a Zara Store - so it's easy walking distance to most of the major sites. It's true that the lobby is not on the main floor and the entrance is on a side street but I didn't find this an impediment in anyway. The staff were very friendly and efficient and spoke English. One drawback was that when you take the elevator to the lobby - you can open up a crowded and small space for check-in so it makes sense to leave your luggage with the bellhop (I rarely do this as hey - I managed to get my luggage all the way from my house to Madrid - so why pay to have it taken the last 50m). We stayed here twice on our trip (going to Barcelona in between) and had 2 different rooms but both with a little balcony facing busy Gran Via (photos provided) which was great for watching the city go by or see the sunset. Even though this street was busy, the windows cancelled any noise. The rooms were spotlessly clean with recent hardwood floors and new bedding. I'm very fastidious when it comes to the cleanliness of hotels, and the Cibeles was top notch on this account. Bathrooms were equally spotless and very new. Spain - as many hotels in Europe - have bidets and these seem to be the first to go when it comes to cleanliness but Cibeles bathrooms were gleaming. My girlfriend was so happy to be back at this hotel after the ancient and dire Continental Ramblas in Barcelona. Rooms were of a good size, though the 2nd room was a bit smaller as was the balcony. We don't often use the extra facilities in a hotel so we didn't eat in the hotel restaurant though we did get room service on the last day and was robbed as you would at any hotel for the privilege - although the food was good. Overall, We'd definitely stay here again - wouldn't even bother researching other hotels next time we go back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: nikdey
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very average. Room smal but very nice, excellent bathroom. very clean throughout. Entrace and reception weren't great. bar prices were reasonable. Staff were excellent, very helfull and trustable. I was only in the hotel to sleep while exploring madrid. And this hotel is perfect for that. There are two tube stations within a couple of minutes walk, and the city tour busses stop outside the hotel. a lot of attractions are within walking distance (SOl, Plazza Mayor and even the royal palace if you've got you walking boots on). The area is lively, but safe as there are hundreds of tourists around. It looks a bit dodgey round the back of the hotel, but you won't have any reason to go down there. I would stay there again for the transopt links.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed mid Jan 05 with my wife. Hotel entrance is understated and lobby is upstairs. Rooms on front of street are a bit noisy but rear rooms are very quiet. Hotel is very central and right on Gran Via. Rooms are fine with aircon, minibar and good bathroom. Breakfast is very good buffett. There is a bar (quiet) but no dinner facilities, since there are many restaurants near-by. Don't eat on Gran Via; head down into Placa Major and it's environs. We paid £65 per night thru' Alpharooms - pretty good value given the location.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Good Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: slamberty
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Cibeles in Sept 2004. Finding the entrance is the hardest part since it is on the side street, not on Gran Via. The room was the largest I have seen in Europe, closer to what you would expect in Vegas. The room was clean, the bathroom was nice, and we never heard a single sound from the street below. The location is perfect for exploring the main tourist areas of Madrid. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to be in the heart of the city. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hotel hidden away but yet in a perfect position.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Cibeles Aug 19 - 21st 2004. The Hotel though a little difficult to enter (as the lobby is upstairs and the lifts are very slow) once inside has a lovely ambience very friendly and clean. The bar area on the otherside of the reception desk was very friendly and user great. Large TV to watch and good service. Breakfast more than adequate for a 4 star hotel. Rooms large for Spain clean and very bright. I had a 6th floor street front and the noise level with door closed was none (I had been warned that this is a problem in Spain) Location perfect and all staff I meet very helpful and efficient. English is a little problem but you can get by. All in all definitely go back and highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “A clean strategically located hotel with a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and modern. The air conditioning worked and the bathroom was nice. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location is excellent on the Gran Via and is near all of the tourist attractions. The buffet breakfast is good but is an extra 13 euros per person, a little steep. Parking is at an adjacent facility and cost ~16 euros a day. Half the stations on the television were dedicated to porn; a few seconds of leud sex acts were followed by and invitation to purchase the show. Be careful if you are travelling with children. I would absolutely stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a 4 star hotel, barely a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was shocked by the entrance, a tiny little front door with a desk and a security man. To get to the main desk, you need to take an elevator to 2nd story. I arrived at 4pm and no bell person was available to take my luggage, he was having lunch. When departing, again no bell person available at 7:30 am. I had to carry my own luggage. I asked if they were sure this was a 4 star hotel, really shocking. They failed TWICE to wake us up. The second time they apologized. Breakfast was poor in comparison with all other 4 star hotels. I was ripped off and I will never go there in my life again. For that money I can get royal treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This website helped me select Tryp Cibeles and we were not disappointed. The location is wonderful, with everything in walking distance. The room was good-sized and comfortable. The staff was pleasant and helpful and we loved the breakfast. It's not a luxury hotel by any means but I would stay there again in a heartbeat. We had a corner room overlooking the Gran Villa. I worried about the street noise but it was OK, since things start out slowly in Madrid every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Located on the central Gran Via which is busy and noisy you wouldn't know it once inside, a central haven! (Its a great location though as you have metro station nearby and 5 minute walk from the old town.) The hotel is luxurious, clean, spacious. There is a top selection for breakfast and staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The room was very spacious and to a high standard. The hotel completed our fabulous weekend in Madrid nicely!

HotelInfo.Name: Tryp Madrid Cibeles
HotelInfo.Address: Calle de Mesonero Romanos 13 | corner of Gran Via, 28013 Madrid, Spain
